p: Current literature confirms that the housefly can transmit bacterial, viral, and fungal pathogens that affect both humans and animals ( 8, 10, 18, 21, 23, 39). For example, one disease transmitted by a housefly is porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome (PRRS) ( 33). It has been shown that the housefly can carry pathogens on the mouth apparatus, hair covering the body, and legs. An important route of insect pathogen transmission demonstrated by the housefly is with faeces, saliva or vomit ( 10). Besides the housefly, Lucilia sericata and Calliphora vomitoria are also found on farms.
